artist: Hashiguchi Goyō; Posthumously published by: Fujiki Kikumaro
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: head and shoulders of a woman with her hair up, holding an orange and blue cloth with floral patterns; woman wears a black kimono with orange and blue butterflies and a gold ring with a blue stone
marks: 大正九年十月 {Taishō kunen jūgatsu} (October 1920) 五葉画 {Goyō ga} (picture by Goyō)
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper with mica
provenance: Unknown red seal on back that could be from a collector.
text: Posthumously printed 1921 by Goyō's student Fujiki Kikumaro 藤木喜久麿. Portrait of the Shinbashi geisha Hisae ひさゑ.
title: Woman Holding a Hand Towel
